page.title: 08MONYASH MARKET
page.content: There are two{markets}held in Monyash every year _ on the{Spring and {August Bank Holidays.}Alot of tourists visit Monyash on these occasions. Many organisations in the village have{stalls on the village {green.}There are tombolas, stalls with jumble, refreshments and games such as 'Bowling for a Pig' and 'Toss the Horse Shoe'. There is usually some {Morris Dancing}on the village green. There is a{Well Dressing}in Monyash during the Spring Bank Holiday week. Two wells are dressed _ one by the adults and one by local children.To dress a well a picture is drawn on to wet clay.The picture is then filled in using natural things such as seeds, flower petals, stones and bark.The Wells are blessed on the Saturday and remain on display for the following week.
